data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: Becoming distant, remote, far off, aloof or far awayRemoved, retired, withdrew to a distanceAlienated, estranged, wide separation, great distancePossessing judgment and prudence, penetrating, effective judgment, depth or far reaching judgmentGo or going a great length or far in hostility.
data.sentence: The word بَعْدِ comes from the root ب ع د and is associated with the meanings: Becoming distant, remote, far off, aloof or far awayRemoved, retired, withdrew to a distanceAlienated, estranged, wide separation, great distancePossessing judgment and prudence, penetrating, effective judgment, depth or far reaching judgmentGo or going a great length or far in hostility.

data.meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
data.sentence: The word عَفَوْنَا comes from the root ع ف و and is associated with the meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
The word عَنْكُمْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.
data.sentence: The word تَشْكُرُونَ comes from the root ش ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to give thanks, be grateful, realize or acknowledge one's favour, praise. shukrun - giving thanks, gratitude. shaakirun - one who gives thanks or is grateful, appreciated and bountiful in reward.. shakruurun - thankful. Sometimes a distinction is made between this word and shaakirun. The former is used to denote a person who is thankful for little or for nothing, the latter grateful for large favours.. mashkuurun - gratefully accepted, acceptable.
